variable.name: CONTAINER_PLATFORM
variable.description: Container platform used for executing the workflow tasks.

variable.name: CONTAINER_IMAGE
variable.description: Name of the container image being used to run the workflow tasks.

variable.name: CONTAINER_GPU_ENABLED
variable.description: If True, containers will run based on images containing libraries that are compatible with GPU.

variable.name: SEARCH_SPACE
variable.description: Specifies the representation of the search space which has to be defined using dictionaries or by entering the path of a json file stored in the catalog.

variable.name: INPUT_VARIABLES
variable.description: A set of specific variables (usecase-related) that are used in the model training process.

task.name: R_Task
task.description: Simple R task template for AutoML.

script.code:
file <- variables[['PA_TASK_NAME']] cat('BEGIN', file, '\n')
# import library library(jsonlite)
########################### DEFAULT PARAMETERS ############################ # ... OPTIMIZER <- 'Adam' # ... ###########################################################################
############################ INPUT FROM AUTOML ############################ # Get the workflow input variables generated by AutoML. # The AutoML workflow uses the SEARCH_SPACE workflow variable # to generate a set of parameters to be used to train your model. # # Example of search space for hyper parameter optimization: # SEARCH_SPACE: {"OPTIMIZER": {"choice": ["Adam", "SGD", "RMSprop"]}} # Put it in your workflow variables. # # For more info, please see: # https://try.activeeon.com/doc/PML/PMLUserGuide.html#_AutoML # input_variables <- variables[['INPUT_VARIABLES']] if (!is.null(input_variables) & input_variables != "NULL"){ input_variables <- fromJSON(input_variables) OPTIMIZER <- input_variables[["OPTIMIZER"]] # ... } cat('Selected optimizer: ', OPTIMIZER, '\n') ###########################################################################
############################# YOUR CODE HERE ############################## # ... # Put your code here # ... ###########################################################################
############################ OUTPUT FOR AUTOML ############################ # Score your trained model loss <- 0 # put your loss here cat('Loss: ', loss, '\n')
# Return the token + loss value token <- fromJSON(variables[["TOKEN"]]) result_map = list("token" = token, "loss" = loss) resultMap[["RESULT_JSON"]] <- toJSON(result_map, auto_unbox = TRUE)
# To appear in Job Analytics resultMap[["LOSS"]] <- toString(loss) ###########################################################################
cat('END', file, '\n')
